medical_history.chief_complaint: Mild neonatal primary hyperparathyroidism and hypercalciuria.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began at birth, with milder symptoms observed over the first 10 months, including elevated serum calcium levels ranging from 10.6 to 11.3 mg/dL. Symptoms progressed to include poor feeding, gastroesophageal reflux disease, recurrent upper respiratory infections, polyuria, and nephrocalcinosis. By 40 months, additional electrolyte abnormalities such as low sodium and potassium were noted.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of complications from hyperparathyroidism including recurrent infections and kidney stones. Also, his older brother died in infancy from neonatal primary hyperparathyroidism and related complications.
medical_history.family_history: The family history includes two affected children, with the older brother having died from multiple organ failure related to the same condition. The parents and an unaffected sister have normal serum calcium and intact PTH levels. No history of hyperparathyroidism, hypercalciuria, or kidney stones in the family is noted.
